intro: Grewia ehretioides, commonly known as the sour fig or red gum tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. Grewia ehretioides is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
